title: Party of Slovenian People
text:
The Party of Slovenian People ("Stranka slovenskega naroda, SSN") is an extra-parliamentary party in <a href="Slovenia">Slovenia</a>. In the <a href="2008%20Slovenian%20parliamentary%20election">2008 legislative election in Slovenia</a>, the party won 0.25% of the popular vote and no seats in the <a href="National%20Assembly%20%28Slovenia%29">National Assembly</a>. In the <a href="2011%20Slovenian%20parliamentary%20election">early election on 4 December 2011</a>, the party won 0.09% of the vote, thus not gaining any seats in the National Assembly. The party won 0.4% of the vote in the European Parliament election on 25 May 2014, failing to gain any seats.
The party has its roots in the <a href="Far-right%20politics">far-right</a> Slovenian National Right party, which was transformed and renamed after its failure in the <a href="1996%20Slovenian%20parliamentary%20election">1996 parliamentary election</a>. In later years, it was associated with the nationalistic organization Hervardi. The party's candidate for the 2008 legislative election was Andrej Šiško, formerly a prominent member of the <a href="ultras">ultras</a> group "Viole Maribor". Šiško was apprehended during a pre-election debate appearance due to an outstanding arrest warrant after failing to appear in prison to begin serving a prison sentence for a 1992 murder attempt.
